intro: Synaphea whicherensis, commonly known as the Whicher's synaphea, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the arid regions of Western Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, commonly known as the carrot or parsley family, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand prolonged drought conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
